p: Streptococcus suis ( S. suis) is an important zoonotic pathogen that causes a wide range of diseases in pigs, including meningitis, septicaemia, pneumonia, endocarditis, and arthritis (Gottschalk et al., 2010). In addition, this pathogen is an emerging zoonotic agent and an important public health issue in East and Southeast Asia (Sriskandan and Slater, 2006; Gottschalk et al., 2007). During a single outbreak in China in 2005, more than 200 human cases of S. suis were reported, with a death total of 39 (Yang et al., 2006). Current studies show that S. suis can cause persistent infections by forming biofilms in vivo (Wang et al., 2011).
